title: Eastern : horizontal. Western : vertical.
content:
Maxim Zhukov posted this New York Times story on ATypI.  
 [www.enneson.com/public\_downloads/pe/typophile/armenians\_celebarate.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20051216114316/http:/www.enneson.com/public_downloads/pe/typophile/armenians_celebarate.html)

There are several interesting remarks about the history and characteristic of the armenian script. In relation to one of them Maxim remarked: “I am not sure of that ‘Eastern letters horizontal / Western letters vertical’ bit, though.” This remark relates I guess to the thread here about cartesian space, as well as some of the diiscussion in the bouma as bounded map thread.
